title: Best elementary schools: Here are metro Denver's the top 25
text: 25 photos 1. Challenge School, Denver. Academics grade: A. District overall grade: A+. Teachers… more The Boulder Valley School District dominates when it comes to the best public elementary schools in metro Denver, according to a new report by education ranking website Niche . Eighteen of the top 25 schools in the Denver area are in the Boulder Valley district, although two other schools took first and second places. 25 photos 1. Challenge School, Denver. Academics grade: A. District overall grade: A+. Teachers… more SLIDESHOW: Click the image above to view the top 25 elementary schools in metro Denver, according to Niche. Pittsburgh-based Niche (formerly known as College Prowler), compiled its ranking of the metro area's and Colorado's top-ranked elementary schools based on metrics calculated and weighted across four categories: Academics grade, based on state assessment proficiency and survey responses on academics from students and parents. (50 percent weight). District overall grade, based on analysis of academic and student life data along with reviews from students and parents. (20 percent weight). Teachers grade, based on teacher salary, teacher absenteeism, state test results, and survey responses on teachers from students and parents. (20 percent weight). Culture & diversity grade, based on racial and economic diversity and survey responses on school culture and diversity from students and parents. (10 percent weight). The ranking looked at 48,625 U.S. public elementary schools, 100 in metro Denver. Hillside Elementary in Berwyn, Pennsylvania was ranked the No. 1 elementary school in the nation. No Colorado schools were in the top 100 nationally. Caitlin Hendee is digital producer and social engagement manager for the Denver Business Journal and covers education.
